name: Stay-Awhile  at Lovers Pt. Pacific Grv
description: Vintage cottage located in the heartbeat of Pacific Grove...one block from the rec trail as well as Lighthouse Avenue, Farmers Market and the Natural History Museum.
host_about:
I love living near the ocean here in Pacific Grove and walk daily with my dogs on the beach.I am a hair stylist and own a salon in Carmel, I own and renovate old houses and love to travel to tropical places. I enjoy walking to great restaurants and the  Farmer's market all within two blocks. This is the perfect location!
I hope your wanderings lead you to places you love.

name: Ocean front 6-bedroom masterpiece
description: In May 2015, Trip Advisor chose Pacific Grove as one of the top scenic destinations in all of the United States!  We are very proud of this honor, and it came from reviews by guests who stayed at my home and others in town. You will love it here!   We operate with Pacific Grove Transient Use License #468.
neighborhood_overview:
I call Pacific Grove "Iowa with a Beach". It is a really friendly small town with everything you need within 1 mile of the house. We have a lovely Farmers Market, Natural History Museum, Movie Theater, shops, restaurants, wildlife and butterflies!
In May 2015, Trip Advisor chose Pacific Grove as one of the top 12 Scenic Destinations in all of the United States. You will love it here!
host_about: I love sharing my home with families on vacation, enjoying a reunion or celebrating a special event. 2024 begins my 14th year hosting guests, and I am very grateful to all of you who come back year after year!

name: Pet-Friendly* Cottage Near Beach for 30+ day stays
description: Our quaint, thoughtfully-stocked 300 sq ft cottage is located steps from the ocean, yet tucked away behind our home, affording guests ample privacy, easy parking and all the amenities of home.  Sip wine on the patio after a day of adventures while listening to the surf, and sleep soundly on our king Saatva Organic hybrid mattress.
neighborhood_overview: Hands down, the best part about our 'hood is the proximity to the ocean.  You can (usually) hear it, and smell it from our house, and see its amazing beauty within a brief walk.  On a clear night, the sunsets are breathtaking.
host_about: My passion for birdwatching and wildlife has taken me all over the world.  While I appreciate international adventures, I also regularly road trip throughout the beautiful west and our home state.  I have an 11 year old plus an king-sized 6 year old and enjoy exploring the world through their eyes. We love and show our Grand Champion Irish Wolfhounds. I’m a sucker for fine dining and not above collecting Michelin Stars unashamedly.

name: CA Dreaming w/Ocean View, Fire pit and Gardens
description: Wake to an ocean view from a comfy Queen bed and enjoy the large granite walk-in shower w/sky window that opens to the warmth of the sun or coolness of the rain.  Relax with your morning brew in the beautiful gardens and sip your evening drink  by the fire pit. Take a deep breath and enjoy the forest/ ocean view followed by the quiet of a star filled sky. This is the CA/Zen blend… magical, peaceful and pure relaxation. Come renew your spirit.  Don't believe it's this good? Read the reviews...
neighborhood_overview: This is a safe and quiet neighborhood.  Many of my neighbors have lived here for decades and they're friendly, kind people. There are lots of kids here, so PLEASE drive  no more than 15MPH once you're in the cul-de-sac. Thanks!!
host_about:
Hi Fellow Airbnbers,
I lived in Pacific Grove for seventeen years and after a two year adventure in Nova Scotia, I am back home!  Before Pacific Grove, I was a longtime Bay Area resident (SF and Berkeley) and am a native Californian.  I have had a variety of careers over the years, but my hobby has always been songwriting. You may occasionally hear (muffled) piano playing and singing from the main house. Being an Airbnb host is a perfect fit for me because I genuinely want guests to have a magical stay while they're here. I am an old school  host (over 1300 reviews ) who believes Airbnb is still about people and community.  I do my best to create a space that will help you relax and renew your spirit.

name: 30 Day Min. Stay, Casa Amarilla , Walk to Aquarium
description: This is NOT a Short Term Rental.  The minimum night stay is 30 nights .  Month to month or 6-12 month lease agreements only.  Upgraded Modern Kitchen & Bathrooms.  5 min. walk to Coastal Bike Path & Cannery Row, and beach.  Pets are welcome on a case by case bases. Additional Pet Fee of $250 will be charged prior to confirmation of reservation.
neighborhood_overview:
Can walk to the famous Cannery Row, coffee shops , restaurants, grocery stores in five minutes.
Distance from the property to :
Knob Hill 0.3 miles (5 minutes walk)
Cannary Row (Aquarium) 0.5 miles ( 7 minutes walk)
Safe Way 1.1 miles
Trader Joes 1.0 miles
Downtown Monterey ( Alvarado St.) 1.9 miles
Pebble Beach (Spanish Bay) 2.0 miles
Carmel 6 miles
host_about:
Over the years, I have been fortunate to have rubbed elbows with some of the most talented people in the Hospitality and Real Estate professions.  Little did I know these mentors would prepare me for my Vacation Rental venture this year.

I've also discovered my inner gift for interior decorating.  Casa Amarilla has been a labor-of-love restoring and modernizing this quaint Monterey Cottage...a stone throw from the Aquarium.

My green thumb came back to life as well.  The patio and fenced garden area has blossomed this spring, and soothes one's sole at the end of an active day.  A wood burning pot belly fire-pit and charcoal BBQ enhance this spacious artistic zen-like garden, while taking in the distant Monterey Bay view...our guests favorite!

While staying at Casa Amarilla, don't hesitate to call or text me if you and your group need anything at all!

Sincerely,
Guita

name: Bright Beach Cottage, Center of town, 30-day
description: Perfect for writers, traveling professionals, small families and featured in a "Pretty Little Lies" article, this adorable, light-filled, historic cottage is just steps from Pacific Grove cafes, restaurants, antique & second-hand stores, the local grocery store, & the famous Monterey Bay Aquarium (not to mention the Bay itself!). Maple hardwood floors. High ceilings. Full bath & stocked kitchen, toaster, stove, fridge, linens, towels.
neighborhood_overview: The City of Pacific Grove was founded as a Methodist retreat and gradually grew into a town with full-time residents, rich in history. In contrast to Monterey, which grew up around the fishing industry, PG was a retreat for city folks looking to escape the cold summers of San Francisco. Small town full of quaint Victorian architecture and cottages like ours built on lots originally sold as sites for camping tents. Next door, Asilomar Park and Conference Center designed by famed architect Julia Morgan, began as a retreat for the YWCA (Young Women’s Christian Association). The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continually operating lighthouse in the state of California.
host_about: We're happiest at home, which we share with our terrier Coco. We’re both writers. My latest novel was The Perfumist of Paris and Brad’s was the short story collection How I Met You. We've lived in Italy, France, Haiti and India and love learning about other cultures. We’re crazy about our neighborhood and will tell you where to sip a great latte, get a bite to eat, shop for wine or shoes, create art, rent bikes, and learn about local history.

name: Lovely House in Pacific Grove (Long term rental)
description:
This lovely remodeled home has 3 bedrooms, den, 2 baths, an office and one car garage. The driveway can fit additional 3 or more cars. It has a secluded outdoor living space with a gas grill. The house can easily accommodate 8 adults comfortably. Centrally located and it is 1 block from the Pebble Beach country club gate entrance and about 1 mile from the Aquarium, Cannery Row, Lover's Point, and downtown PG.
Minimum stay of 30 days.
neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the small-town charm of Pacific Grove as you explore the many shops and restaurants of this Central Coast town. With the world famous 17 miles drive and Pebble Beach as your back drop, you can experience why some have called this region as the  paradise on earth. There are endless things to do such as biking or hiking through the beautiful trails along the beach; kayaking, snorkeling, or scuba diving in the Monterey Bay. Don't forget to discover the dramatic exhibits at the Monterey Bay Aquarium or historic Cannery Row. Another great area attraction for fine dining and souvenirs is the Monterey Fisherman’s Wharf where some of the country’s best seafood and clam chowder are served.
host_about:
I am an engineer working in the Silicon Valley.  My wife and I have been married for over 30 years.  We enjoy biking, hiking, skiing, and traveling all over.  We love the Monterey and Pacific Grove area ever since we took our two kids on a bike trailer going through 17 miles drive when they were just babies.  We bought this house in Pacific Grove and we like to share this beautiful area with other folks from all over the world. 

Our motto in life is:  work hard and play even harder.

Looking to stay in a quaint little house, this is it!! Clean, cozy, and in great location–cheerful 2-bed 2-bath home located on 17 Mile Drive near Asilomar Beach with easy access to Pebble Beach, Monterey, and Carmel.

WiFi, Apple TV, and an once a month cleaning included. Also comes with all utilities (water, gas, electricity, trash & sewer) and gardening services.

name: 760 Ocean View at Lovers Point Park
description:
True ocean front house featuring 2 view decks, and 180 degree view of the Pacific coastline and Monterey Bay. Watching the ever-changing Pacific Ocean by day, and a dazzling blanket of twinkling city lights by night. Amazing activities year round.

Pacific Grove STR License # 0165
Please refer to city website for details
neighborhood_overview:
Imagine whale watching from your own deck as they enter the Pacific Grove Marine Gardens Park (an under the ocean park) directly across from the house. Watch the scuba divers diving just a stones throw from the shoreline. Two-blocks to famous centrally located Lover's Point Park. Take a walk along the beach on the Monterey Bay Coastal Trail; past Asilomar Beach, onward to Pebble Beach and the famous 17-Mile Drive. Or towards Monterey Bay Aquarium, Cannery Row and Fisherman’s Wharf by the historic downtown Monterey with its shops & restaurants.

Stroll down Ocean View Boulevard to Lover's Point Park and rent a bike or surrey (4-person bike), travel along the Monterey Bay Coastal Trail to the Aquarium, Cannery Row and Old Fisherman's wharf and beyond! Save the parking fees because of the convenience of never needing to take your car. Bike rental is available at the Lover's Point Park (next to the snack bar) and at Cannery row as well. description: Enjoy strolling through the small shops or dining in the exquisite small family owned restaurants or enjoy the gorgeous oceanfront recreation trail or famous Monterey Bay Aquarium, all just steps away from the penthouses
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove, nestled between Monterey and Pebble Beach exudes nostalgia of a by-gone era! name: Peaceful Space near DLI + Cannery Row
description:
Connected to main house, yet quiet and private.
Separate entrance.
Large Tub/Shower.
TV, Refrigerator, Coffee maker.

Close to Stores, Restaurants, Beaches, Aquarium, DLI.
neighborhood_overview:
This is one of the historic neighborhoods of Monterey, known as New Monterey, up on the hill above Lighthouse Avenue. It's a nice neighborhood with views of the Bay, fresh air, trees and birds, great neighbors.

It's easy walking distance to Safeway, Trader Joe's and many cafes and restaurants, also very close to DLI and Cannery Row.
Five minutes drive to Community Hospital (CHOMP).
Ten minute drive to Carmel or Downtown Monterey.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Monterey. I've driven a taxi here off and on for many years, and have really enjoyed getting to know the community from this perspective. Monterey Peninsula is a very interesting and diverse place with a lot of great people.

I like to read, go to movies, and walk on the beach with Wendy. I like meeting the people who visit Monterey, and I like to travel too. I like reading about current events, science and history. Wendy likes social media, shopping and thrift stores.

name: Cute & Stylish Cottage +HOT TUB
description:
Hello and Welcome to your new home away from home…

*NEWLY REDECORATED*
2 BED + 1.5 BATH + HOME OFFICE!

(PET CONSIDERED) Please read in full.

This property is located far back from the street— hidden within the fairy tale oak trees. You will have plenty of privacy to use the outdoor spaces to your liking, including the jacuzzi and BBQ.

You will be located less a few minutes away from Asilomar Beach, Pebble Beach, Downtown PG, Monterey, and Carmel.

Min 30 night booking. Flexible dates.
neighborhood_overview: Our home is centrally located in the Monterey Bay. The cottage less than a five minute drive to the following: Carmel-by-the-Sea, Pebble Beach, Monterey Bay Aquarium, Downtown Monterey, and less than a few minutes to Asilomar Beach.  Beautiful hiking trails in the city of Pebble Beach located within a few minutes walking distance from our house.
host_about: Hello, my name is Toni and my daughters name is Sophia. We have lived  on the Monterey Peninsula for twenty two years now. We are great lovers of nature and what it has to offer.  Both of us are ocean girls born and raised on the ocean. We are honored to host you. Thank you!

name: Breakers Room - Seven Gables Inn
description:
Breakers is so amazing, it was spotlighted on national TV in the VISA commercial about Seven Gables Inn. Decorated in cream, pastel blues and peach, it's our most popular hotel room! Named the Breakers Room because the room directly overlooks the crashing breakers of the Monterey Bay Sanctuary.

*Rooms are sanitized following the Clean+Safe protocol outlined by Calif Lodging Assoc. Due to COVID-19 there is NO interim maid service.
*Complimentary breakfast
* Restaurants very close to Inn
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables, a biking and hiking trail running for miles along the oceanfront and spectacular natural scenery.  Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.  Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff 

Note: This information was updated on August 13th 2021

description:

You can hear the surf from the back porch. Minimum age to book is 25. Note - Pacific Grove has banned home and condo rentals less than 30 days. description:
Escape to this master suite with a private entrance. Experience breathtaking views of the world famous Monterey Bay. Listen to the waves and watch sea life play from your adjustable King bed. Unwind with a glass of wine or fresh morning coffee in a pair of comfy chairs or at the dining table for two.

Private entrance, Mini fridge, microwave, coffee pot, 40’ TV, washer & dryer, private stone patio, BBQ & dining table. Quiet neighborhood!

Our neighborhood is very quiet both day and night. Easy access to a walking trail along the coast will lead you into Monterey and the Monterey Bay Aquarium.

We are 3/4 miles from Lovers Point beach with fine dining and casual food.

We are 1 mile from downtown Pacific Grove, a very quaint little town with a variety of fine restaurants .

name: Cottage Retreat Steps from the Sea
description:
This sweet, vintage cottage is close to the beach, restaurants and dining, great views, and family-friendly activities. You will love the beautiful light, comfy furnishings, great outdoors space, and quaint and quiet neighborhood. Unfortunately, we can not accept pets.

Pacific Grove License # 0295
neighborhood_overview: Feel the calming sea breeze in a quiet serene neighborhood.  A quick walk to activities, shopping, restaurants and night life.
host_about: We are Jim and Viveca and we look forward to hosting you at our Cottage Retreat, just steps to the sea!  We have lived in Pacific Grove for over 30 years, and love the friendliness and beauty of our community.  Joy manages our property and lives two minutes away from the house.  She rides bikes, I ride horses and Jim rides waves. Together, we will do our best to make sure your stay at our cottage by the sea is perfect!

name: Guest Quarters Near Asilomar & Pebble Beach #0335
description: City Lic.#0335. 3 blocks from the beach and 2 blocks from Asilomar State Park, we are located in a quiet forested neighborhood 1 mile from historic downtown Pacific Grove.  Includes use of living, dining rooms & kitchen. Living room features high ceilings and gas fireplace. Our 1/2 acre wooded lot has fruit trees and a vegetable garden.  Note: Access requires 3 steps down from the driveway and 3 steps up to the entry, both with handrails.  We comply with Pacific Grove's "Home Share" regulations.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is located in a pine and oak forest.  Between us and the shoreline (about a block away) is a row of sand dunes that shelters our garden from the winds off the ocean.  The neighborhood is very quiet and peaceful, with very little traffic..  Asilomar State Park and Conference Grounds (and Asilomar beach) is just around the corner, and the historic Point Pinos Lighthouse (built in 1855) is also an easy 15 minute walk away. The Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, which give Pacific Grove its title of "Butterfly Town USA" is right in our neighborhood and just a ten minute stroll from our place.

name: Dolphin House - Great Location! *30 day min stay*
description:
Dolphin House is a quaint, light-filled beach house with a 30 day minimum stay. It is centrally located in a quiet neighborhood a short walk from Downtown Pacific Grove, Monterey Bay Aquarium, restaurants, the coastal recreation trail and beaches. A binder in the kitchen provides information. It provides a great home base for visiting wineries in Carmel Valley, Point Lobos, Carmel, Monterey, Moss Landing, and Salinas.
The house consists of two bedrooms and one bath.
neighborhood_overview: The house is a half mile walk from the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row shops and restaurants. Less than half a mile in the other direction is downtown Pacific Grove with more shops and restaurants.  A binder in the kitchen shows some of your options. Thousands of Monarch Butterflies overwinter (October to March)  in Pacific Grove. You can visit the Butterfly  Sanctuary where they cluster in the trees to conserve heat when the temperature is lower than 55 degrees F.  When they sunlight warms them, they fly off to gather nectar.  You can often see them hanging in the trees or flying about.  Monterey Bay is visible from the house and less than half a mile away.  Beaches (Lovers Point for family beach  play is great), bike and walking/running trails await.  Drive a short way down Highway 1 to Point Lobos for hiking and viewing ocean cliffs or to Carmel Valley for wine tasting.  Take a whale watching cruise in Moss Landing ( Sanctuary Cruises) or try clam chowder sample tasting from M
host_about: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in the Monterey Bay Area in 1969 and fell in love with it.  In 2015 we found this lovely house.  We hope you enjoy the area and our home as much as we do!

name: Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Carmel only 2-day min
description:
Only 2 night minimum - compare to the others which are 30!

Light, airy, second story space gives you peak of bay and treetops with skylight/windows. Next to Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, 400+- sq ft STUDIO space that is private. Free wifi.

The butterflies are here! AND we have whales in the bay:-)

Close to Asilomar, Monterey Bay Aquarium, Pebble Beach and Carmel.

A relaxing space to unwind after your visit to Carmel Valley or hike in Big Sur.
neighborhood_overview:
Centrally located to experience Pebble Beach, Monterey and Carmel. A drive around the bay takes you to Santa Cruz and a short drive south leads to Big Sur. The studio has a "peak" of the ocean and you can definitely hear the ocean on most nights. Asilomar is less than a mile away as is the recreation trail to walk, job or ride your bike. On Mondays PG hosts a farmer's market in the evening. Our studio is located in a neighborhood and there is ample street parking.
It is also next to the butterfly sanctuary and all the monarchs are gone you are sure to see deer and make sure you make the time for an adventure on the whale watching boat because there are a lot of humpbacks in the bay!
host_about:
I’ve traveled to 13 countries and 15 states, and that’s just since I was married! I love to travel and want you to feel safe and comfortable. The Treehouse space is active with birds and squirrels and butterflies when in season. You will often see deer out your window.

The Monterey Peninsula is my second favorite discovery spot (Galapagos is my first) and we will share tips with you to get the most out of your visit.

With Covid-19 it can be a scary time and we have put protocols in place that protect us and you.

Cheers! To safe getaways and discovery.

name: No shared space! Guest suite! PGLic#0405
description: Our place is close to Carmel and Monterey, some of the best dining, family-friendly activities, Fisherman's Wharf, Pebble Beach, The 17-mile Drive, Monterey Bay Aquarium, Lover's Point Beach, Downtown Pacific Grove, Downtown Monterey, and Asilomar Beach. Point Lobos is about 10 mins and Big Sur is only 45 mins away!
neighborhood_overview: We live in a very safe and peaceful neighborhood.  Pacific Grove has an extremely low crime rate. One of the safest places in America! Very family-friendly. It is a residential area, but minutes from all the fun stuff! One mile from the BEACH!  We are only a couple of blocks from Pebble Beach.  Also, there is a beautiful forest a couple of blocks away to take a tranquil walk.
host_about: We are both veterans and have been married for 25 years now.  Josh has been running a moving business for 22 years and Angi is a stay-at-home mother.  We both love Korean, Thai, Japanese, and Mexican food!  Together we host a private room in Pacific Grove, California and love meeting new people and helping enrich their time traveling here.

name: Casa Mariposa - The Live-In Museum
description: Welcome to Casa Mariposa, the live-in museum. Nestled in the heart of PG, our home is a natural history museum packed with fossils, minerals, crystals, biologic specimens, art & artifacts that we personally unearthed throughout the world. We have genuine fossils that span all geologic time: From 2.2 billion-yr old stromatolites to 100,000-yr old Saber-toothed Tigers. Yes, even dinosaurs. Both adults & kids who visit Casa Mariposa come away with a better appreciation for Nature & natural history.
neighborhood_overview: Casa Mariposa is centrally located in a quiet sunny neighborhood of Pacific Grove.  We are within walking distance of the Ocean, Cannery Row, Lovers Point, Asilomar Beach, Spanish Bay, Point Pinos Lighthouse, Pebble Beach, and much more.  Also near Washington Park and the Monarch butterfly sanctuary.
host_about: Casa Mariposa is the home of Julie Martinez and Jon Kramer, globe-trotting adventurers with natural history backgrounds and a passion for Earth and all its incredible worlds and cultures.  Julie is a natural history illustrator and art instructor.  Jon is a geological engineer and solar energy developer.  Together they author adventure guidebooks.  You will see some of Julie’s art on these walls and their joint adventure guidebooks on the shelves.  Many fossils and rocks from their various geologic adventures are displayed throughout the property.

name: Pacific Grove Cottage, Entire House [30 days min]
description:
Charming private get-away within walking distance to Lover's Point, Asilomar State Beach, Downtown Pacific Grove, Washington Park, Lighthouse, and Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, and of course the Monterey Bay Aquarium (2 guest passes provided). Cannery Row is just a short hop away. 17 Mile Drive begins a block away towards George Washington Park. Ocean peak view from the upstairs bedroom, and clear view of the Monterey Bay. Live oaks on property providing an enchanted forest feel.
30-day minimum
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighbors, and occasional deer in season. Stand at the intersection of Washington Park and Pine Ave and see the ocean on [3] sides.
host_about:
Long term Californian from the Bay Area , but originally SoCal. Surfing is my favorite hobby feel free to ask me about local spots and even Santa Cruz or spots further still. Getting to know the local mtb spots like Fort Ord and Toro Park [across the road there], also familiar with further spots like Santa Cruz mtns and the spots off Skyline Dr. on the peninsula.

I hope you enjoy your stay and expect that you will have a good time in our spot in Pacific Grove.

description:
Mid Century Pacific Grove house on 17 Mile Drive. Just a couple blocks from the Pebble Beach gate. Great area. Close enough to walk to downtown restaurants and shops, Asilomar State Beach and other sites all within minutes of our home. Private yard with a deck and outdoor furniture for entertaining.

Lic. # 0289 - Our City STR Permit restricts us to a maximum of 2 adults per reservation. Any additional guests MUST be under 18 years old.

host_about: Lee and I started Airbnbing our home on the coast.  We both were a bit timid about it to begin with. name: Pacific Grove Willis House, Walk to Town and Beach
description: Experience the Monterey Peninsula like a local in the owner-hosted and remodeled Willis House in the heart of Pacific Grove. Downtown PG is a short stroll and Lovers Point Beach & Park is just beyond that. A little farther afield are Asilomar State Beach, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, and the towns of Monterey, Pebble Beach, and Carmel. Day-trippers can enjoy the Big Sur coast, year-round whale watching, and Point Lobos State Natural Reserve. (NOTE: Children ages 10+ welcome.)
neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove is situated centrally on the Monterey Peninsula between the towns of Monterey and Pebble Beach. Our neighborhood is residential, quiet, and filled with well-kept older houses and cottages of vernacular architectural styles, particularly Victorian, Craftsman, Stick, and Shotgun.

An easy four-block walk takes you to downtown Lighthouse Avenue, a wide and walkable boulevard with independent restaurants, coffee houses, bakeries, markets, and shops. You'll also find a hardware store, pharmacy, library, natural history museum, and post office.

From downtown, a short stroll takes you to Lovers Point Park & Beach, where you can relax on the grass or sand, or rent bikes, kayaks, standup paddleboards, or family surreys from Pacific Grove Adventures. Surfers and divers will find outfitters in Monterey.

In Pacific Grove's Forest Hill shopping district (distinct from downtown and a one-mile drive from the house), you'll find supermarkets, larger stores
host_about: I'm Chris. I host a single home with undivided attention. I've lived in Pacific Grove for more than 20 years and I'm happy to talk about the house and area. I work in the cottage next door but the extent of our interaction is up to you. I enjoy meeting people and hearing their stories but also appreciate their need for privacy. Should we pass each other during the course of your stay, feel free to ask a question, chat, or just wave hello.

name: Mermaid's Delight
description:
Mermaid's Delight is our cozy, welcoming 2 BD, 1BA bungalow. Our home is listed on the PG Historical Society proudly with a plaque on our door "Callie Thomas” We do hope that you enjoy our “get-away”. Please note the height in the stairway leading to the master is a bit low but well worth it. Beautiful ocean views! We’re just a few steps from the Monterey Bay Sanctuary our major cross street is the famous Ocean View Blvd. Enjoy the tranquility & time to un-plug.
Permit #0407
neighborhood_overview: This is an historic retreat area with adorable beach bungalows along the prettiest coastline California has to offer.  Lover's Point is just a few houses away with a beach great for small children. Bikes, surreys and kayak rentals are located there as well.
host_about:
We truly love living so close to the beach! It is our go to place to relax, unwind and just have fun! 
Many happy memories  and we continue to make with our family and friends here. It is such a magical place we truly hope you enjoy your stay!

name: Furnished Studio/Cottage In Pacific Grove
description:
30 day rental, minimum. Lovely studio cottage in Pacific Grove, walking distance to Asilomar Beach, downtown PG, nearby grocery and outdoor activities. The renovated cottage has wi-fi, kitchen, cable, luxury linens, heater, A/C, washer/dryer, fully furnished for a relaxing stay. Single occupancy ONLY.

Minutes to NPS, DLI, Pebble Beach, Carmel, and Monterey. Rates negotiable for more than one month stay. Perfect for the traveling health professional or military student!
neighborhood_overview: Charming neighborhood—kids walk to school daily!!! A bit of car noise during the day, but it’s quiet after 8pm.
host_about: My husband and I love life and enjoy sharing it with others.  I love to cook and drink good wine.  Being a good host is all about making others feel comfortable.  I'm a Southerner at my roots, so ya'll come and visit--I might have a nice glass of iced tea waiting for you!

name: Mermaid Beach House, Walk to Beach / Aquarium!
description:
Relax and unwind at our beach getaway that's within walking distance to Lovers Point beach (right across the street!), Downtown Pacific Grove, Cannery Row, and Fisherman's Wharf. Just a few steps out the front door is a glorious 7-mile walking/bike trail that meanders from the Monterey Bay Aquarium around the point to the expansive Asilomar Beach, a favorite spot for walking in the soft sand and enjoying gorgeous sunsets. This house can accommodate up to 7 guests.

PG License #0171
neighborhood_overview: Grab your towel and beach chair, you will be within walking distance to the beautiful Lovers Point Beach!
host_about: Tommy is a Creative Director and Mallary is a Denim Designer living in Modjeska Canyon, CA, with two boys named Hank & Charlie! We are very easy going hosts and guest experience is our #1 priority. We're very hands off but always available if you need us. We look forward to having you as our guest!

name: Enjoy a month-long vacation in June or September!
description:
Due to city laws we are only able to rent for 30 days; guests may stay for a shorter time, but will need to pay the full month’s rent.
Our home, just a short walk to the water and downtown, offers a sunlit open floor plan, 2 bedrooms with ample closet and drawer space, a large backyard with hot tub, off-street parking and a bit of an ocean view. A bright, spacious kitchen with island, large dining table, and cozy living and family rooms with fireplaces make for a casual and comfortable retreat.
neighborhood_overview: PG is an often-overlooked coastal gem. Its tree-lined streets and Victorian architecture still evoke faint echos of its 19th century days as a Methodist retreat. Our neighborhood is also the shoreline of the Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary, and our home is just across from the Pacific Grove Golf Links, adding wonderful open space. It's a short, easy walk to both downtown "PG" with its quaint B&Bs, coffeehouses and restaurants, as well as the Coastal Recreation Trail and the beach at Lovers Point where you can rent kayaks, bicycles and surreys.  Our street is wide and the driveway is large enough for large vehicles and even an RV. We're also convenient to major and local events, being a short drive or bike ride from the Concours d'Elegance,  AT&T tournament, Jazz Festival and other Peninsula special events. Pacific Grove has its own hometown events well worth taking in, from Good Old Days in April to the Butterfly Parade in October. The monarch butterfly sanctuary is a short walk
host_about:
Hank and I have raised three daughters (now all in their 20's) in this home.  In 2016 we decided to undergo a major remodel to turn our house from child-centric to a comfortable open living space to enjoy and entertain.  We're loving it and hope you do too!
We're active 60-somethings who love the sport of triathlon and its individual components of running, biking and swimming. The Monterey Peninsula is a great place for active people.
We love traveling (you'll see the world map with our family's various travel spots), both domestically and abroad.  Our newest purchase is an RV to explore the U.S.

name: "Mainstay Cottage" Just Steps To Beach & Town!
description: License #0379. Open floor plan, single level 1300 ft. Sleeps total SIX. 3 Bedrooms, 2 Full baths. Ideal for small family, 3 couples, 4 singles. 4 beds: 1 King, 1 Queen & 2 Twins. Quality beds/linens & furnishings. Cozy fireplace, all new appliances. Dining for six. Private patio off kitchen with BBQ. Walk to park, beach, town, water sports, bike rentals, public kids pool! Stroll to amazing Aquarium & historic Cannery Row! Free street parking & EV charging nearby.
neighborhood_overview: This historic "retreat" neighborhood of Pacific Grove is highly coveted and sought after by second home owners & vacationers from around the world. Attracted by the many charming Victorian houses that comprise this neighborhood & the close proximity to the beautiful beach & town, this neighborhood is a walkers paradise so park the car & enjoy all the nearby activities. This neighborhood is filled with quaint cottages that surround a lovely tree-lined central park where people can enjoy picnicking & even basket ball. For younger children, the park offers hours of play time on the various play equipment. Located in the heart of town, walk to a day at the beach or the Monterey Recreation Trail for a great afternoon of fun. In summer, you will discover a small beach in a protected cove that often provides a calm sanctuary for water play at the water's edge. Nearby, the recreation trail offers biking and walking along a spectacular coastline where sea otters frolic in the kelp & whales and
host_about: We have lived on the Monterey Peninsula for 60+years & raised a family here in Pacific Grove. A custom builder by trade, my husband Richard started his own construction company & is known for building many beautiful homes around the peninsula. I have a degree in sociology/pschology & an interest in art & design. Our passion is ocean sailing logging many miles from California to New Zealand & with our teenage daughter from Monterey to Tahiti.

name: Studio Blu in Pacific Grove
description: Cozy studio located in Pacific Grove. The perfect place to stay while you enjoy the Concours d'Elegance, the AT&T Pro Am golf tournament, or any of the other special events in the area. Great location with easy access to downtown PG (8 minute walk), Lover's Point Beach, Monterey Bay Aquarium (15 min walk), and some of the best dining and family friendly activities that PG has to offer.  Easy access to Asilomar, 17 mile drive, Carmel by the Sea, Carmel, Pebble Beach, Point Lobos, and Big Sur!
neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove is a coastal city known for its Victorian homes, Asilomar Beach, and its coastal migration of Monarch butterflies (Butterfly Town, USA). The city is also home to the oldest continuously working lighthouse on the West Coast, Point Pinos. The Pacific Grove Natural History Museum, located in downtown PG, is a living field guide to the Central Coast, showcasing native flora and fauna.
The Monterey Bay Coastal Recreation Trail offers breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean and is a wonderful way to tour PG, Monterey, and surrounding areas, while enjoying the outdoors.
host_about: We live, work and raise our son on the Monterey Peninsula.  We love to share our little slice of paradise with guests and fellow travelers.

description: Welcome to Pacific Suite. Located on Lighthouse Ave. in Pacific Grove. Two blocks from the ocean. name: Fairlawn Room - Seven Gables Inn
description:
The Fairlawn Room is attached to the front side of the Main House on the northwest corner, a few steps above the front garden. With soft colors of creams and tans, it features a lovely ocean view with a private outside entrance from the garden pathway.

• Rooms are sanitized following the Clean+Safe protocol outlined by Calif Lodging Assoc. Due to COVID-19 there is NO interim maid service.
• Complimentary breakfast.
• Lots of restaurants very close to Inn.
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables, a biking and hiking trail running for miles along the oceanfront and spectacular natural scenery.  Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.  Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff

name: Mermaid Crossing License #0473
description: Experience the best of both worlds with this unique getaway offering two beautifully appointed homes in one private, serene setting. The main house features two cozy bedrooms, while the charming guest house boasts a king-size bed and a full bath. Enjoy breathtaking ocean views from every room, making this the perfect retreat for relaxation and rejuvenation.
neighborhood_overview:
“Mermaid Crossing” is located on Mermaid Ave. the premier destination for those who want easy (walking or biking) access to all the conveniences and attractions but would rather enjoy the quiet serenity this zone provides. At Mermaid Crossing, you can park the car and forget about it. Walk out the front door and take 70 steps until your toes touch the water at famous Lover’s Point, a calm swimming beach during the summer that boasts great surfing during the winter months. Take in the jaw-dropping views of the entire Monterey Bay as you stroll along the Monterey Recreation trail to the front doors of the world renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium.
Great dining options abound the closest being the historic Beach House at Lover’s Point which has a full bar (open late) and gourmet seafood. Bringing your clubs? The Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Links is quite literally, in your backyard. Enjoy it’s stellar reputation as one of the “Nation’s Top 50 Gold Courses under $50.00” by Golf Digest.
host_about:
Rhonda is the managing broker of Pacific Grove Property Management. Their goal is to make your stay with them pleasurable enough to leave you longing to come back! They love where they live and can't wait to share it with you!  
CADRE# (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)

name: Monterey Peninsula Ideal Accommodation
description:
This apartment is located just three blocks from the beach, and is the perfect starting point for a scenic 17-mile coastal drive to Carmel. Pacific Grove is an all-season vacation destination with abundant dining, shopping, arts & culture, nightlife, water-sport activities, and home to championship golf courses.

a) MUST STAY 1 FULL WEEK
b) MUST CHECK IN/OUT ON A FRIDAY

neighborhood_overview:
The Monterey Peninsula is world-renown for its beauty! Enjoy the Monterey Aquarium, Fisherman’s Wharf and historic Cannery Row. Great golf, fine dining and plenty to see and do. Whatever your pleasure the Monterey Peninsula is the perfect vacation destination, and Pacific Grove is in the heart of it all.

Sharing borders with the City of Monterey, the Pacific Ocean, and the Del Monte Forest, Pacific Grove offers breathtaking views and recreational activities. The City provides services to the community including: excellent fire, emergency, and ocean rescue services; an award-winning natural history museum; the lowest crime rate of any city in Monterey County; a nationally-recognized 18-hole golf course; a monarch butterfly habitat sanctuary; sandy beaches; and, the oldest continuously-operating lighthouse on the west coast. "P.G." is known for its small-town hospitality and friendliness, so come experience it yourself!

Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables.
A biking, running and hiking trail goes for miles along the oceanfront.
Lover's Point beach and quiet cove 2 blocks away.
Kayak and bike rentals most of year at Lover's Point.
Spectacular natural scenery.
Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.
Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff 

Note: This information was updated on August 13th 2021

name: Di Blasi Room - Seven Gables Inn
description:
The Di Blasi Room is a great spot to relax! Quiet your mind in this spacious luxury room as you overlook the beautiful patio and garden with a vista of the Monterey Bay in the distance. Enjoy Di Blasi's unique furnishings including a stained-glass window, a gas-log fireplace, and large armoire.

• Rooms are sanitized following the Clean+Safe protocol outlined by Calif Lodging Assoc. Due to COVID-19 there is NO interim maid service
• Complimentary breakfast
• Restaurants very close to Inn

description:
The Lover's Point Room, accented in deep burgundy, gold, emerald green, and soft beige, has a direct ocean view looking at its namesake, Lover's Point, and wonderful afternoon light displayed through the floor-to-ceiling, 3-foot wide by 5-foot tall window!

• Rooms are sanitized following the Clean+Safe protocol outlined by Calif Lodging Assoc. Due to COVID-19 there is NO interim maid service.

name: Sallie’s Cottage
description:
SALLIE’S COTTAGE

Pacific Grove￼ STR license #0396

This cozy, comfortable historic cottage, with a beautifully updated interior, is a wonderful place to relax. It’s location, blocks to downtown and the amazing rugged shoreline, is the perfect home base for exploring the strikingly beautiful area.
neighborhood_overview: The house is very close to downtown and the beach, an easy walk in either direction. The neighborhood is full of quaint historic buildings, shops, and restaurants. There is plenty of on street, also off-street parking for one car in the driveway.
host_about:
I'm an architect, with with a background in design, land planning and historic preservation. I have a passion for nature, family, dogs, horses, travel and adventures.

My husband Tom is an ecologist, coastal biologist and park planner. Obviously, he is also a lover of nature!

Together Tom and I have painstakingly restored two historic houses in Pacific Grove... Including our 120 year old Airbnb cottage, which we started more than 30 years ago.

We've traveled the world together and separately, drawn to near and distant locations by friends,  culture, waves, and whimsy.

Airbnb hosting has allowed me to share the cottage that I love with people who enjoying it as I do. It is a genuine pleasure meeting the terrific people who visit on their adventures!

name: Charming house between downtown and the beach
description:
Fully furnished 2 bedrooms, plus a private den and 2 bathrooms in a charming, updated Victorian beach house. Located perfectly between Lovers Point Beach and downtown Pacific Grove. It's a quick walk to the beach, restaurants, coffee shops, bookstore, farmer's market, library and small grocery store.

Nestled on a lovely street-to-street lot. The back of the house is on Caledonia Ave, just across the street from beloved Caledonia Park.
neighborhood_overview: This home is in a prime location in the coveted Pacific Grove "Retreat" neighborhood. Walk to the beach, park, restaurants and the grocery store.
host_about: I'm a Pacific Grove enthusiast. I was born and raised in this beautiful little town by the seashore. I went off to college in Southern California then had many other adventures in Central America and the Bay Area for about 10 years before happily returning to Pacific Grove. I love the natural beauty, walkability, mild weather and rich history in Pacific Grove. I truly believe Pacific Grove is one of California's best kept secrets. I'm honored to host people in Pacific Grove and share a little of what I think is a truly magical place.

name: Ocean-Front Lover's Point Studio, Pacific Grove
description: Studio unit sleeps 3. Separate entrance- lower level w/queen size bed & single hide-a-bed.  Full bathroom with granite shower & floors.. Small kitchenette: microwave, refrigerator and BBQ on the patio. Washer and Dryer on premises. Watch the waves crashing on the rocks, sail boats, and birds flying over the Monterey Bay. Steps to Lover's Point beaches and Beach House Restaurant. Walk to the Aquarium, Asilomar, Natural History Museum , art galleries and restaurants from this fabulous location
neighborhood_overview: Lover's Point area with fabulous restaurants, art galleries, boutique shops, coffee shops, bakeries , museums, churches and much more.

name: Ocean Front Pacific Grove Cottage
description: Although very simple the architectural design takes in the view completely.  It feels like you are sailing or flying over the water from the large picture windows. The living room has a hide-a-bed and a Futon and even a loft bed so  you don't lose a second of looking out the windows. The Master suite is like a rustic cabin with hints of elegance and a very comfortable queen bed. the kitchen has all the modern conveniences. We have had guests from around the world stay with us.

name: Spectacular Award Winning Ocean Front 2 Bed 2 Bath
description: Award winning historic ocean front home with beautiful Spanish revival decor overlooking Monterey Bay. Gather around the ocean front fire pit and watch whales, seals, sealions, otters, dolphins  from the traditional Talavera tiled patio. Ideally situated for walking to Pacific Grove, Cannery Row, Monterey Aquarium and Fisherman's Wharf. Fine dining, bars and shopping are a short stroll away. Convenient access for 17 mile drive, Carmel and Big Sur. A spectacular home in a World famous location.
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is described as the last home town in America. It is a charming community which has the largest density of Victorian homes in the Country. Surrounded by the natural wonders of Monterey Bay it is an ideal vacation destination for all that Central California has to offer. It is a paradise for golfers, surfers, divers, cyclists and kayakers.

2437 sf, 4 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom vacation home sleeps up to 8 guests. 1 Split King, 2 Queens, 2 Twins. No pets. No garage. This is a main house on a property shared with a small guest house. Laundry is shared.

Sanctuary Vacation Rentals is proud to present Yellow House! Home sleeps up to 8 guests.

Four Night Minimum Stay Year Round (excluding certain holidays and events).

A dream-come-true vacation home - the house is 2437 square feet, 4 bedroom, 2.
neighborhood_overview:
Please download our App to obtain our local recommendations and area attractions. Access to the App is automatically provided via email after your reservation is paid in full. You can share this app with all the guests in your party.
Please note that our Good Neighbor Policy is posted in our home and is strictly enforced.
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals offers quality accommodations with relaxed elegance on the central coast of California. You’ll find comfortable beds, well-equipped kitchens and all the comforts of home. Many of our properties are pet friendly.

If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxing stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.

description:
Steinbeck is located on the bright southwest side of the Beach House. Decorated in aquamarine and light gold, the room has nice afternoon light. The Steinbeck Room is highlighted by high ceilings, a small armoire, and a crystal chandelier. Gaze out at ocean views from a tall bay window.

name: BLOCKS FROM OCEAN -COZY QUEEN-A GETAWAY FOR TWO
description:
The room is located on the premise of two Victorian houses known as Pacific Grove INN.
The Pacific Grove Inn is a Historic Boutique Inn, that provides charming accommodations & A perfect location one could ask for :
4 blocks from the lighthouse (Downtown)
8 blocks from the beach & Lover's Point
1 mile to the aquarium
Short drive to Pebble Beach, Carmel, 17- Mile drive & Monterey

With only 16 hotel rooms & suites, Pacific Grove Inn blends an old world charm with modern day luxury.
neighborhood_overview:
We welcome you to experience the romance of the historic Pacific Grove Inn

The Pacific Grove Inn is a Historic Boutique Inn, that provides charming accommodations with the intimacy of a bed and breakfast. Built-in 1904 and 1908 by Sea Captain Frank LaVerne Buck and Apothecary Joseph Tuttle, these two establishments were remarkably sophisticated for their time and place in Pacific Grove on the Monterey Peninsula and are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

With only 16 hotel rooms and suites, Pacific Grove Inn blends an old world charm with modern day luxury including combinations of fireplaces, private porches, balconies, and entrance with views of the Monterey Bay.

A sanctuary of tranquility and charm awaken your senses with a continental breakfast, unwind in the evening with your fellow guests in the parlor.


Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capi

We welcome you to experience the romance of the historic Pacific Grove Inn

The Pacific Grove Inn is a Historic Boutique Inn, that provides charming accommodations with the intimacy of a bed and breakfast. Built-in 1904 and 1908 by Sea Captain Frank LaVerne Buck and Apothecary Joseph Tuttle, these two establishments were remarkably sophisticated for their time and place in Pacific Grove on the Monterey Peninsula and are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

With only 16 hotel rooms and suites, Pacific Grove Inn blends an old world charm with modern day luxury including combinations of fireplaces, private porches, balconies, and entrance with views of the Monterey Bay.

name: La Piccola Casa "The Little House"   Lic. # 0446
description: Every house has a story but few are as iconic as La Piccola Casa. Built in early 1900, La Piccola  has had a diverse journey.  This lovely Victorian lady spent her early years as a Pacific Grove residence before becoming La Piccola Pizzeria & Coffee Shop in 2005.  After years of serving thousands of guests, La Piccola has taken on a new life.  Lovingly restored by restaurateurs, Joe & Laurie Rombi, she has returned to her roots as a residence while still retaining memories of her culinary past.
neighborhood_overview:
Just a few short blocks to the ocean, La Piccola is located on one of the most convenient streets in Pacific Grove. She's surrounded by restaurants, coffee shops, a juicery, bakeries, a movie theatre, grocery store and shopping. To name just a few of the amazing eateries on the very same block of 17th Street are La Mia Cucina (best Italian on the Peninsula!), Takara (Sushi) and Fandango (Continental Cuisine). With Grove Market just a stone's throw across the parking lot, all your grocery needs are met without ever getting in the car!

Parking passes will be provided for the lot directly across the street. Please be sure to read the FINE PRINT in the Policies / House Rules Section for more details.

name: Otters Cove/Ocean Views-Walk to Beach/Aquarium
description: A walker’s paradise minutes to beautiful Lovers Point Beach & Family Park.  Walk to town with great cafes, fine dining, shopping & movie theater. Easy stroll to spectacular ocean and bike trail, Monterey Bay Aquarium and famed Cannery Row. Ideal space for couples or families with children. The perfect monthly vacation rental or beach retreat. This lovely home has been recently renovated. All the furniture is high-end combining style with comfort. Children & 2 adult Aquarium passes provided.
neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove is a popular destination and much appreciated for its cool coastal summer weather & spectacular scenic beauty. This magnificent location continues to entice travelers from around the world for famous attractions such as:

The AT&T Golf Pro-Am
Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance
Monterey Jazz Festival
Laguna Seca Sports Car Championship
Pebble Beach Food and Wine Festival
Pacific Grove Feast of Lanterns
Monterey Fisherman’s Wharf
Monterey Bay Aquarium
Big Sur National Park, plus so much more.

The home is located in a quiet neighborhood, a ten minute drive to Pebble Beach, Spanish Bay or any of the famous golf courses within the gates of 17-Mile Drive. Monterey and Carmel are also just a quick car ride from the home’s location.

name: Charming Cottage Steps to Ocean!
description:
Custom dates available. Please reach out with any questions!

One of the closest homes to the white sand beaches at Lovers Point & blocks from downtown Pacific Grove. The Aquarium is less than a mile down the trail.

This cottage, built in 1892, exudes charm with original redwood floors, stained glass and ornate carved detail. A light, airy beach house, modernized for a relaxing getaway!
neighborhood_overview:
Lover's Point Beach is steps away for playing and picnicing, renting bikes, kayaks and paddling with the harbor seals and sea otters.

Pacific Grove has dozens of great restaurants, coffee shops, and wine bars— within a short walk of the house. The recreation trail on the coast is just a few steps away and will take you to all of the sites. Pacific Grove is a great walking and biking town.

Downtown:

* Captain + Stoker and Bookworks for coffee

*‘Peppers’ Mexican, our favorite spot, is 2 blocks up our street and is awesome! Pacific Thai on Lighthouse is another one we love. Wild Fish, also on Lighthouse, has wonderful fresh seafood with live music on the weekends!

*Michaels has the best Mexican take out, IL Vecchio on Central Ave is hands down the best Italian Restaurant in town (dine outside or takeout- generous portions and GREAT Cannoli!), Zum Sushi on Central is awesome for takeout as well.

*Asilomar beach for bo
host_about:
Hi!  I’m Anne! 

My husband and Gary and I have lived in Redwood City long enough to raise and launch 4 out of our 5 daughters! :)  We love the two Northern California gems of the SF Bay Area and Pacific Grove.   We absolutely love hosting and look forward to welcoming you soon!

name: Private Stand-alone Cottages near Ocean & Beach
description:
Retreat to the Pacific Coast to experience a breath of fresh ocean air at this quaint Victorian boutique hotel. Centrella Hotel has been a peaceful retreat destination of choice for charm and romance since 1889.

Plus, enjoy a complimentary breakfast of parfaits and fresh scones.

Ideally located: 2 minute walk to Lover’s Point & beach. 15 minutes walk to world-famous Monterey Bay Aquarium and historic Cannery Row. Close to Pebble Beach, Carmel and Big Sur.

Select Cottages are Pet friendly.
neighborhood_overview:
Ideal location in a peaceful & charming neighborhood.

- 1 block from Pacific Grove downtown with many romantic restaurant, wine tasting rooms, cafes and boutique shops.

- 2 minute walk to Lover's Point Beach (one of the most popular beaches on the Monterey Peninsula) and coastal recreational trails.

- 10 minutes walk along the coastal recreational trail to the world-renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row.

- 5 minutes drive to Pebble Beach & 17-Mile Drive.

- Short drive to Carmel by the Sea and world famous Highway 1 to Big Sur.

name: Lovely Forest Home on One Acre in Pacific Grove
description: Clean and spacious 2 bedroom, 2 bath home in beautiful Pacific Grove, CA. Accommodates 4 adults and 2+ children. Queen bed in master bedroom, Full bed in second bedroom, Pull-out queen sofa bed in living room. 10 min. walk to beautiful Asilomar Beach with white sand, gorgeous views, and amazing dog beach. Located between Monterey and Carmel on a large (1 acre) forested lot with fire pit and outdoor dining. Just a few min. drive to the entrance gate of scenic, 17 Mile Drive. Pet friendly.
neighborhood_overview: The house is set back from the road and is very quiet and peaceful.  There are nature trails and walks nearby, including the beautiful coastal path along Oceanview Ave. It is a short five minute drive to the restaurants and shops at Cannery Row, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, and another few minutes from there to the Monterey Wharf.  It is close to all of the attractions on the Monterey Peninsula, yet tucked into a sleepy forest neighborhood. At night you can sit at the firepit and stargaze while listening to the ocean waves washing ashore. It is truly amazing!
host_about: We fell in love with Pacific Grove while attending the annual Monterey Car week in 2014. We purchased two PG homes later that year, which we now operate as Airbnbs. We have just added our Huntington Beach home as an AIRBNB rental.  All three homes are wonderful properties and we have many repeat guests.

neighborhood_overview:
Coast Estate invites you to experience the beautiful Monterey Peninsula and California Central Coast. The are is world renown for spectacular coastlines, unique coastal communities, and rich marine life. Coast Estate specializes in Luxury Vacation Rentals in Big Sur, Carmel, Carmel Highlands, Carmel Valley, Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Monterey and Seaside.

Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capital of California”, due to the annual migration of the Monarch butterflies. Pacific Grove is known for well kept Victorian homes and amazing seascapes along the scenic Sunset Drive.

Asilomar State Beach offers visitors beach and coast trail walks and a short, accessible boardwalk loop through the Asilomar Dunes Natural Preserve. The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continuously operating lighthouse on the West Coast and may be toured in the afternoon. 

Lovers Point Park has becom
host_about:
Our CEO, MaryJane was an executive with the Hyatt for seven years. She chose to leave the work force and stayed home to raise three boys! MaryJane fell into a job I loved, managing a Vacation Rental Company on the Monterey Peninsula and fell in LOVE with the idea of renting homes instead of Hotels. She left the company and started her own business to continue her passion for meeting people near and far and sharing the love of travel.

AirBnb had software problems, and had to recreate several of our listings,  under a second account.

You may see MaryJane's 149 Guest Reviews from the original Host Account.

name: Seagull House Downtown Pacific Grove
description: We offer serenity in our luxury flat on floor 2 above downtown Pacific Grove. Please note this property is our second home and as such there are some clothing items stored in the closets plus condiments in the refrigerator  and some food items in the kitchen. help yourself to anything in the kitchen. Walk to Lovers Point beach four blocks down the hill past the Monday afternoon farmers market. Entry room to elevator from the street. Comfortable, contemporary decor. STR license #0438
neighborhood_overview: We are nearly in the center of downtown Pacific Grove. Our street leads directly down to Lovers Point Beach and the walking/bike coastal trail along our beautiful peninsula. A block away enjoy restaurants, shops and art. The grocery store, Grove Market is a block away as well as our famous Pavel's bakery. Go early on Saturday as the line is out the door and up the street. We have a fantastic Barber shop, art supply store, vinyl record shop and historical museum. The Monterey Bay Aquarium is a 20 minute walk along the ocean and historic Cannery Row and The Wharf are all in walking distance. We love our location and hope you will too.
host_about: Coastal Californian. Lover of travel, design, art, music, film, garden, food and many other forms of creativity.

name: Seal Rocks Room - Seven Gables Inn
description:
The extremely popular Seal Rocks Room is decorated in rose, green, and cream. Lay in bed and enjoy and outstanding view of Monterey Bay and Lover's Point Beach through a twelve-foot-wide picture window. The full bathroom has tub/shower combination in tan and rose marble.

*Rooms are sanitized following the Clean+Safe protocol outlined by Calif Lodging Assoc. Due to COVID-19 there is NO interim maid service.
*Complimentary breakfast
* Lots of restaurants very close to Inn.
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables, a biking and hiking trail running for miles along the oceanfront and spectacular natural scenery.  Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.  Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff 

Note: This information was updated on August 13th 2021

name: Three Mermaid’s Cove ( License #0459) Penthouse
description: Three Mermaid’s Cove is located on the desirable Mermaid Avenue in Pacific Grove.  This modern Penthouse provides views of the ocean and is just steps away from Ocean View Boulevard’s majestic ocean front.   Take a walk down to the end of the street to Lover's Point Beach or take a stroll a few blocks up to town and enjoy a multitude of wonderful restaurants, great coffee, and PG’s quaint neighborhood. Experience PG like a local!  Only a short distance to the Aquarium, Monterey, and Carmel.
neighborhood_overview:
“Mermaid Crossing” is located on Mermaid Ave. the premier destination for those who want easy (walking or biking) access to all the conveniences and attractions but would rather enjoy the quiet serenity this zone provides. At Mermaid Crossing, you can park the car and forget about it. Walk out the front door and take 70 steps until your toes touch the water at famous Lover’s Point, a calm swimming beach during the summer that boasts great surfing during the winter months. Take in the jaw-dropping views of the entire Monterey Bay as you stroll along the Monterey Recreation trail to the front doors of the world renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium.
Great dining options abound the closest being the historic Beach House at Lover’s Point which has a full bar (open late) and gourmet seafood. Bringing your clubs? The Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Links is quite literally, in your backyard. Enjoy it’s stellar reputation as one of the “Nation’s Top 50 Gold Courses under $50.00” by Golf Digest. O
host_about:
Rhonda is the managing broker of Pacific Grove Property Management. Their goal is to make your stay with them pleasurable enough to leave you longing to come back! They love where they live and can't wait to share it with you!  
CADRE# (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)

name: Half Block to Beach-Walk to Monterey Aquarium 270G
description: This home is a half-block from the beach! 10-minute walk to the famous Monterey Bay Aquarium. 10-minute walk to downtown Pacific Grove where many top restaurants and fun shops are located. The home has a fully-equipped kitchen, Natuzzi Italian Sectional Leather Sofa, and large windows throughout the home in every room. High-speed internet with a brand new 55" 4K Samsung Smart TV. The entire unit has been completely remodeled recently and has a modern beach vibe that you will love!
neighborhood_overview: Very nice neighbors, they are quiet, peaceful and respectful. Please pay respect to the neighbors as well. Thank you very much for your cooporation!
host_about:
I am the founder of "Another Day in Paradise - A Luxury Vacation Rental Company" which was established in 2017. We partner with Airbnb to provide travelers unique and unforgettable vacation experiences during their stays. Regardless of whether you are on a leisure or a business trip, our goal is to make sure you stay at a relaxing, comfortable, and tranquil space where you would enjoy your best vacation time.

I truly believe our guests deserve the best! From selecting the furniture, mattresses to even bath towels and silverwares, we always ensure that any items we provide to our guests have to be high end and stylish with highest quality to offer. Our interior design for each property is aimed to create an ambience of a relaxing vacation-like touch and feel with modern design elements.

Year after year, we have been adding new properties to our portfolios. We have over 25 vacation rental properties throughout California, including Bay Area, Pacific Grove, Half Moon Bay, Chico, Clear Lake and South Lake Tahoe. And we are expanding to the East Coast, Massachusetts, as well as Bora Bora, French Polynesia, and more and more amazing world-renowned travel destinations. We own all of our properties in order to provide the highest quality of service. 

When I travel, I always stay at Airbnb properties. I personally have very high expectations when staying away from home, and I hope all our properties meet yours, knowing you are traveling away from your home. My team members include my partner, Carrie, a customer service crew, a cleaning crew and a repair / handyman crew. They are on call 7-days a week at your service. We strive to exceed expectations to all of our guests with the utmost respect and respond. We will ensure each property is thoroughly cleaned with enhanced cleaning protocols, and with fresh bed sheets, towels, and bath rugs upon your arrival.

I am also an active member of Airbnb.org which is a non-profit organization started by the founders of Airbnb. On a daily basis, we donate a certain percentage of our revenue from each guest's booking to Airbnb.org. Our mission is to provide homes during times of crisis, and unlock the power of sharing space, resources, and support in times of needs! We partner with the worldwide communities to open housing in emergencies in order to offer shelters for people who lost their homes.

Thank you for reading our story! My team and I can't wait to hosting you in the near future!

name: Shell's Treasure: Fully Updated Three bedroom home
description:
Welcome to Shell's Treasure

Easy living in this remodeled luxurious three-bedroom, two-bath home in the Beach Tract of Pacific Grove.

Located one block from the beach, relax and gaze out at the ocean from multiple vantage points throughout the home.

The open concept floor plan seamlessly flows from the living area to the kitchen and dining area where sliding glass doors open up to the expansive rear deck, the perfect place to unwind listening to the crashing waves.

 Thoughtf
neighborhood_overview:
Coast Estate invites you to experience the beautiful Monterey Peninsula and California Central Coast. The are is world renown for spectacular coastlines, unique coastal communities, and rich marine life. Coast Estate specializes in Luxury Vacation Rentals in Big Sur, Carmel, Carmel Highlands, Carmel Valley, Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Monterey and Seaside.

Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capital of California”, due to the annual migration of the Monarch butterflies. Pacific Grove is known for well kept Victorian homes and amazing seascapes along the scenic Sunset Drive.

Asilomar State Beach offers visitors beach and coast trail walks and a short, accessible boardwalk loop through the Asilomar Dunes Natural Preserve. The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continuously operating lighthouse on the West Coast and may be toured in the afternoon. 

Lovers Point Park has becom
host_about:
Our CEO, MaryJane was an executive with the Hyatt for seven years. She chose to leave the work force and stayed home to raise three boys! MaryJane fell into a job I loved, managing a Vacation Rental Company on the Monterey Peninsula and fell in LOVE with the idea of renting homes instead of Hotels. She left the company and started her own business to continue her passion for meeting people near and far and sharing the love of travel.

AirBnb had software problems, and had to recreate several of our listings,  under a second account.

You may see MaryJane's 149 Guest Reviews from the original Host Account.

name: Cypress Room - Seven Gables Inn
description:
The romantic, elegant Cypress Room is the largest guest room in our hotel and features a 22-foot corner bay window with window seat featuring a spectacular 180-degree view of the Pacific Ocean and coastline. One of the 2 most popular rooms at the Inn.

• Rooms are sanitized following the Clean+Safe protocol outlined by Calif Lodging Assoc. Due to COVID-19 there is NO interim maid service.
• Complimentary breakfast
• Lots of restaurants very close to Inn.
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables, a biking and hiking trail running for miles along the oceanfront and spectacular natural scenery. Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other. Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff 

Note: This information was updated on August 13th 2021

A charming and cozy upstairs bedroom with queen bed, single bed, and rollout bed, private bath, at the Old St. Angela Inn in Pacific Grove.

The Old St. Angela Inn is a 1910 Craftsman-style Bed and Breakfast in Pacific Grove on the Monterey Peninsula. This Pacific Grove home is a local treasure listed on the city's historic resource inventory. The house won a Heritage Society award. While totally restored with modern conveniences and appliances, all the charm dating back to 1910 is retained.

This quiet home is located within easy walking distance of downtown Pacific Grove. Lovers Point Beach is an easy 1/2 mi. walk and Asilomar Marine Reserve is 1 mi. away. Monterey Bay Aquarium is a 30 minute walk along the ocean.

30 night minimum.

name: Welcome to Sea-Glass House! 1BR (PG License #0478)
description: Enjoy a waterfront bay view from your private spaces (including a bedroom, a deck overlooking the bay, and a spacious bathroom) in a shared house. This stylish place to stay is perfect for couples or someone coming to town for work who wants to maximize their time actually at the waters edge.  Sea-Glass House is less than 10 min drive to area’s most popular attractions. Deck is perfect for dinning or having a glass of wine. Depending on the season, watch whales, dolphins, and otters swim by!
neighborhood_overview:
We are located less than a minutes walk from the Bay, in a beautiful charming neighborhood and are second row from the Bay. We have a tiny adobe bungalo house in front of us that allows us spectacular Bay views. We have our own private path directly to the Bay. You can walk the incredibly gorgeous beach path (just steps from our house) to most tourist attractions. Driving times are : 3 minutes drive to Lovers Point,
6 minute drive to the Aquarium & Cannery Row, 6 minute drive to Asilomar Beach for amazing sunsets! There is a great quiet beach for kids just a five minute walk from the house called Anchors Away Beach. The beach in front of our house is rocky and has cool tide pools!
host_about: I married my high school sweetheart Andy. We co-host our Airbnb. Andy is an amazing cook. We love to spend time at the beach, or at our house looking for whales, sea otters and dolphins. I am an artist and Andy is a CPA. Our skills work great for our Airbnb. We love hosting people and giving suggestions on where to eat and what to do in our area. Making people’s vacations better is very satisfying!

host_about:
I am the founder of "Another Day in Paradise - A Luxury Vacation Rental Company" which was established in 2017. We partner with Airbnb to provide travelers unique and unforgettable vacation experiences during their stays. Regardless of whether you are on a leisure or a business trip, our goal is to make sure you stay at a relaxing, comfortable, and tranquil space where you would enjoy your best vacation time.

I truly believe our guests deserve the best! From selecting the furniture, mattresses to even bath towels and silverwares, we always ensure that any items we provide to our guests have to be high end and stylish with highest quality to offer. Our interior design for each property is aimed to create an ambience of a relaxing vacation-like touch and feel with modern design elements.

Year after year, we have been adding new properties to our portfolios. We have over 25 vacation rental properties throughout California, including Bay Area, Pacific Grove, Half Moon Bay, Chico, Clear Lake and South Lake Tahoe. And we are expanding to the East Coast, Massachusetts, as well as Bora Bora, French Polynesia, and more and more amazing world-renowned travel destinations. We own all of our properties in order to provide the highest quality of service. 

When I travel, I always stay at Airbnb properties. I personally have very high expectations when staying away from home, and I hope all our properties meet yours, knowing you are traveling away from your home. My team members include my partner, Carrie, a customer service crew, a cleaning crew and a repair / handyman crew. They are on call 7-days a week at your service. We strive to exceed expectations to all of our guests with the utmost respect and respond. We will ensure each property is thoroughly cleaned with enhanced cleaning protocols, and with fresh bed sheets, towels, and bath rugs upon your arrival.

I am also an active member of Airbnb.org which is a non-profit organization started by the founders of Airbnb. On a daily basis, we donate a certain percentage of our revenue from each guest's booking to Airbnb.org. Our mission is to provide homes during times of crisis, and unlock the power of sharing space, resources, and support in times of needs! We partner with the worldwide communities to open housing in emergencies in order to offer shelters for people who lost their homes.

Thank you for reading our story! My team and I can't wait to hosting you in the near future!

neighborhood_overview:
Coast Estate invites you to experience the beautiful Monterey Peninsula and California Central Coast. The area is world renown for spectacular coastlines, unique coastal communities, and rich marine life. Coast Estate specializes in Luxury Vacation Rentals in Big Sur, Carmel, Carmel Highlands, Carmel Valley, Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Monterey and Seaside.

Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capital of California”, due to the annual migration of the Monarch butterflies. Pacific Grove is known for well kept Victorian homes and amazing seascapes along the scenic Sunset Drive.

Asilomar State Beach offers visitors beach and coast trail walks and a short, accessible boardwalk loop through the Asilomar Dunes Natural Preserve. The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continuously operating lighthouse on the West Coast and may be toured in the afternoon. 

Lovers Point Park has beco
host_about:
Our CEO, MaryJane was an executive with the Hyatt for seven years. She chose to leave the work force and stayed home to raise three boys! MaryJane fell into a job I loved, managing a Vacation Rental Company on the Monterey Peninsula and fell in LOVE with the idea of renting homes instead of Hotels. She left the company and started her own business to continue her passion for meeting people near and far and sharing the love of travel.

AirBnb had software problems, and had to recreate several of our listings,  under a second account.

You may see MaryJane's 149 Guest Reviews from the original Host Account.
